message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.NE 

This paper deals with the problem of learning to linearly combine a large number of kernels and learn a good predictor based on the learnt kernel. This problem is relevant to several areas of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), and neural networks (cs.NE). The paper proposes a randomized version of the mirror descent algorithm to overcome the computational challenges of multiple kernel learning, which is a common problem in these areas. Therefore, it is likely that this paper belongs to one or more of these sub-categories.
